intro: Oxalis sternbergii, commonly known as the desert wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of five-petaled yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family, which is known for its calcium oxalate crystals in the leaves. Oxalis sternbergii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
